==Japanese==

===Kanji===
{{ja-kanji|grade=2|rs=女05}}

====Readings====
* {{ja-readings
|on=[[まい]] (mai)
|kun=[[いもうと]] (imouto), [[いも]] (imo)}}

===Etymology 1===
/imo<small>1</small>/ → /imo/. The medial /m/ means "woman, female" and is found in a number of related terms: [[女|me]], [[女|onna]], [[女神|megami]], [[嫗|omina]], [[母|omo]] etc.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|いも|acc=1|acc_ref=SMK2}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|いも}}

# a close female companion; a sister or wife

=====Derived terms=====
* {{l|ja|妹}} (imōto)

===Etymology 2===
{{m|ja|妹|tr=imo<small>1</small>}} + {{m|ja|人|tr=hi<small>1</small>to<small>2</small>|person}}: /imopitə/ → /imoɸito/ → /imowito/ → /imouto/ → /imoːto/.

====Pronunciation====
* {{ja-pron|いもうと|y=k|acc=4|acc_ref=SMK2,NHK}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|いもうと}}

# one's own younger sister
# a younger female
